title: James May on the Moon  (BBC 2009)
description:
James May (from Top Gear) commemorates the 40th anniversary of the Apollo moon landings with this extraordinary documentary in which he meets three of the men who walked on the moon, before experiencing the thrill of weightlessness, and the bone-crushing G forces of a Saturn V rocket launch. 

Finally, he puts on his own space suit and flies to the edge of space in a U2 spy plane, where he looks down at the curvature of the earth, and upwards into the black infinity of space.

One of those rare programmes that makes you feel proud to be human!

Enjoy!!
